name: Courtyard Palm Desert

reviews.title: Pleasant choice
reviews.text: A fine Courtyard property with the usual room arrangement (sofa, writing desk, swivel chair). Keep in mind that it is on the northern outskirts of Palm Desert, at least until the developers build out to the I-10 freeway (just to the north). The staff is friendly, but the dining area is only open for breakfast. The River entertainment mall is a short distance away, south on Bob Hope Drive.

reviews.title: Great hotel, service and location!
reviews.text: I spend about 40-50 nights during the course of the year at this property...Conveniently located right off I-10 if you are driving and in a perfect location for starting a "trip" to anywhere in the Desert communities. The hotel is SPOTLESS....Always clean and many of the staff have worked there for awhile so the service is great and consistent. If you need a quick bite to eat, Applebee's is located right next to the hotel and a major grocery store is only about a 1/2 mile away. Whether you are in the Desert for business or pleasure, I highly recommend this hotel and will be staying there again in 2008!
I stayed here for only one night while attending a conference a different hotel. I didnt have a lot of time to fully judge this hotel but I will give my opinion of my brief stay.
reviews.title: Brief Stay at the Courtyard

reviews.text: This is your typical Courtyard. Room was very clean. Bed was comfortable. Free Internet is always a plus when traveling on business. Available channels on cable was plenty. Hotel has pool and jacuzzi. Location is convenient to the I-10.
reviews.title: Great Renovation

reviews.text: One issue was that the bathroom drain stopper was working properly. I had to take it out completely to allow the water to drain.
reviews.title: TOO SMALL FOR THE MONEY

reviews.text: Otherwise hotel was fine for the purpose that I was in town for but I thought the rate of $180 with AAA discount was STEEP. It was high season travel for Palm Springs though.
reviews.title: Beautiful Views of Mountains

reviews.text: My experience at this hotel was ruined by the noisy garbage pick-up which took place right below my balcony at 6 AM on a Saturday morning! Additionally, the noise from the road which is adjacent to the property can get loud, especially if there're a few motorcycles passing by, and that can spoil your time on the room's balcony. The room was adequate, nothing special, and a tad on the small size. The big pluses of this property are the Applebee's Restaurant within walking distance of the hotel, and easy access to I-10. A night is fine here; more than that I'd look to another property for some peace and quiet.
reviews.title: Garbage Pick-up At 6 AM

reviews.text: I found the Courtyard Palm Desert the perfect location for our stay. It is only 5 minutes from the highway, but since it is a mile away, you are in a nice quiet location with no road noise. It is very convenient to visit the Living Desert, or hit the road to get to Palm Springs, Joshua Tree Monument, or Anza Borrego. The quality was outstanding, and I must say we are very picky. The room was clean, well kept, and large. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was coffee and tea available for free in the morning, and an excellent buffet with fast service. Next door was an Appleby's restaurant with carside service, which was especially nice if you are out hiking all day and don't want to sit in a restaurant. If you want nice places to go in Palm Springs, just follow the road in front of the hotel to shopping and restaurants. Don't miss the Palm Springs Tramway - outstanding! All in all, we were very satisified.
reviews.title: Excellent stay
OK,very busy middle of nowhere though
reviews.text: Stayed there one night on a PL bid of $47.Room was smallish but not tiny,first floor(no balcony)and was fine for my needs.
Facilities are pretty well maintained.Staff was ok(asked for a late checkout and was ok'd for 1 pm)
reviews.title: Comfortable and Friendly Staff
Room smelled like mold but in general it was okay
reviews.text: But this place is really far from anything of interest-a good 15 minute drive to Rancho Mirage,longer drive into Palm Springs.

Checked in late and left real early, so I didn't get a chance to check out the hotel, but my room was clean and nice. The bedding is top notch, with a very European sytle duvet and a nice mattress pad. The location is just off I-10, but wouldn't take long to drive downtown. There is an Applebee's next door, but other than that, it is kinda out by itself. Most rooms appeared to have a balcony as well. One highway stop away from the Agua Caliente casino too.
reviews.title: Clean and nice

reviews.text: The mattress of the kingsize bed in our third-floor room slanted a bit and was soft. The air conditioner was next to the desk so that, when working on the computer, one had the choice of being too warm without it or frozen with it. A disinfectant smell was pervasive in the room and bathroom. We had breakfast there the morning we left: plastic and tasteless(not from the buffet and not cheap. The staff was not friendly or, with one exception - Maria - helpful. We won't ever be back.
reviews.title: Very disappointing two-night stay

reviews.text: Had a three-night stay (Thursday thru Sunday) at a Priceline rate of $52. The hotel was quite full by Saturday. I received a room without a balcony, but on an upper floor with south facing orientation as requested. However the only view I had was of the tree tops, jacuzzi, and Residence Inn next door. Parking was convenient.
reviews.title: Nothing Special
Bad Bad experience
reviews.text: The room had a musty smell when I entered, which disappeared after the a/c was turned on. I was never disrupted by noise. There were a few permanent stains on the carpet, which is starting to look worn. The bedding was comfortable and clean, with good pillows. The vanity area is small, the room is smallish. There is in-room coffee and lobby coffee in the morning. Local calls are charged 50 cents, but there is no charge for toll-free calls. I never saw anyone in the fitness room, which has a few treadmills and bikes. I did not try the breakfast, which was not included in the Priceline rate. There is an Applebee's next door.

A basic stay with a comfortable bed and good service. The swimming pool is nice and there are lots of towels in the cart on the pool deck. The free internet is not wireless and is not the fastest I have seen, but it worked and was easy. Easy to find and convienient to I-10
reviews.title: A clean, comfortable stay with a balcony and good coffee maker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: Arriving with my girlfriend at the hotel, the Courtyard Marriott, the temperature was well in the mid 90s. The hotel greeted with a welcoming front clerk. Check-in lasted a whole four minutes. After dropping off our stuff in the room, we headed to the Rancho Mirage, which is a shopping center with restaurants such as Cheesecake Factory and P.F. Chang’s. Because of the hot weather, I got a cone of Chunk Monkey from Ben & Jerry’s. Then we found an air conditioned Borders to relax and read in. After getting ready, we headed for my 7pm reservation at Cliffhouse. We had a $100 gift certificate that we won in a basketball shooting contest. We started off with 2 appetizers, crispy Calamari with jalapeño dipping sauce and Corn Fritters “Oscar Style.” The calamari was tender and not like other calamari you would find at places such as Yardhouse. The Corn Fritters, which consisted of blue crab, asparagus, and béarnaise, were small but delicious. I also ordered the Fischerman’s Chowder, which tasted like any other clam chowder but had an extraordinary spice to it. For the entrees, my girlfriend ordered the Filet Mignon, which was cooked to medium rare and was super tender. It came with mashed potatoes as well as green beans. I ordered the special, which was the Halibut. It included rice and green beans. The total bill came out to $92, so I guess we did a pretty good job of getting close to $100 without going over. Also, I do not suggest going to this place unless you are willing to spend a hefty dollar because I know that I will not be going back unless I get another certificate. After dinner, we headed to Ralph’s to get drinks and snacks for the hotel. That pretty much concluded our night as we just lounged in the hotel relaxing.
reviews.title: Better than Average Expectation

likes.disliked: — Thin walls that allow you to hear everything next door (and they're hearing you, too).

reviews.text: In my opinion, this property is beginning to show its age. As mentioned in other reviews there was slight, while not pungent, order that seemed to come with age. The room had a king-sized bed that seemed to overwhelm the room. Overall the room simply looked dated. Pool access is a concern. The cardkey security feature is broken and unrepaired or was disabled. Duct tape is holding the latch open so simply pulling on the handle gains access to the pool. Overall friendliness and helpfulness is marginal to acceptable. When asked about a business center, the front desk informed stated the computer was broken. This person was unconcerned, stated they had no idea when it would be coming back and offered not further assistance. The breakfast did not seem to be worth the price, so passed on it each day. This leaves only few nearby options. For the price charged by this property, more was expected.
reviews.title: Okay, but showing its age...
A good place to stay
reviews.text: Between Christmas and New Year's Day we stayed here for two nights. We wanted to visit Joshua Tree National Park and a friend recommended we use Palm Desert as base. We found this hotel on the Internet and booked a room. We are glad that we did, because it was great place to stay. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful.
